children.value: On this page, you will find everything you might need or want to know about the
If you are unable to find the information you are looking for, don't hesitate to contact us directly at
The Creathors Platform is a place for creators of any kind to share their work with their fans, whether it be videos, images, or simple thoughts they want to share with their community.
We strive to make it as easy as possible for creators to focus on what they love by giving them the ability to monetize their work through subscriptions and/or pay-per-view.
Even though monetization is the main idea behind the Creathors Platform, we also offer creators the option to share their work publicly, without hiding it behind a paywall.
You might be familiar with the subscription model, where people pay a monthly fee to gain access to exclusive content. But what is pay-per-view, and how does it work?
Pay-per-view allows fans to unlock a specific post by paying a one-time, often lower price, instead of subscribing at a higher price.
This option is perfect for fans who want access to very specific posts and might not be interested in other content that comes with subscriptions.

contents.title: Account
contents.description: General information about your Creathors account.

children.value: Only general information is on this page. If you want to know more about creator-specific features, head over to the
Your initial name will be randomly generated. You can change this anytime in
Anyone can create a Creathors account. It is the single requirement for using the platform; you won't be able to see or interact with posts without one.
You can register using your email or your existing account from
To enhance account security, we don't use passwords, which can be compromised.
Instead, you can either log in with one of the existing accounts you used for
, or we will send you a one-time code to your email.
This ensures that only you can access your account.
We value your privacy and share almost none of your information publicly.
The only publicly visible information about your account are:

It is currently not possible for users to change their own email. We are working on implementing this feature, and you can expect to be able to change your email soon. In the meantime, if you need to change your email, please contact us at
Only information about creator's accounts is on this page. If you want to know more about general account functions, head over to the
Account tags are used for better filtering on the discovery page, as well as displaying the main focus of your creator's page.
The main tag is the one tag that will be displayed right under your name. It should reflect the primary focus of your content.
You don't have to include the main tag again; it's automatically used for filtering.
Other tags are used for filtering on the discovery page. Use all the tags you would like to be recognized by to attract a potential new audience.
Do you have any other social accounts you would like to connect? Let us know at
, and we will add them for you.
Socials are links to other social media accounts that will be displayed under your name.
You can include either the name of your account or the entire URL; we will handle the formatting for you.
You can upload your own profile picture and background, but make sure they have the correct size, otherwise, they might look stretched.
You can choose any username and description you want, but the username must be unique.
Changing your username will also change the link to your creator's page.
The discovery page contains information about all accounts.
The sorting is based on the number of subscribers and the date of account creation.
Changes to your account settings will be reflected within 24 hours.

contents.title: Billing
contents.description: On this page, you will find everything you need to know about how we process payments and payouts.

children.value: This page contains useful information for creators. If you want more information about how we handle billing for fans, head over to the
for processing all payments. Most of the information on this page is based on how Stripe handles certain scenarios.
To start receiving payouts, you first need to connect a Stripe account to our platform.
You can easily do this by going to
, selecting your country, and following the Stripe onboarding process.
and linked a payout option, you will be able to start receiving payouts.
Payouts are processed automatically at the start of each month. You can expect payouts to arrive within the first week of the month.
When you receive a payment, there is a 7-day delay before the funds are ready to be paid out. This delay is primarily for fraud and dispute protection.
All payments are available for payout
For example, if you receive a payment on the
of the month, it will be available for payout on the
, meaning we handle the collection and remittance of taxes. However, we do
provide tax advice or take care of tax reporting for you. You are still responsible for complying with tax regulations in your jurisdiction.
, we handle the collection of taxes on the payments made through our platform. However,
we do not handle tax reporting
We collect and remit the taxes to the appropriate authorities.
Itâ€™s important to consult with a tax professional
to ensure you are complying with tax laws and obligations specific to your location.
on all payments made through our platform. "Exclusive tax" means that the tax is:
of the price your fans pay.
in the price you set for your products.
* tax. You will receive your cut out of the *
* you set for your product, and the
tax is withheld and remitted by us to the appropriate authorities.
While we are the merchant of record and handle the tax collection and remittance,
you are still responsible for your taxes
This includes ensuring you comply with your local tax laws and regulations.
You must report and pay any taxes due to your local tax authority as required by your jurisdiction.

contents.title: Posts
contents.description: Everything you need to know about creating and editing posts.

children.value: We strive to make creating and editing a post as easy and straightforward as possible.
You can create a post by going to
and filling in the required fields.
You can edit a post by clicking on the
Both creating and editing a post share the same form, ensuring predictability in how the post will look.
You can set any post as
by toggling the button in the form.
This makes the post take priority over all non-pinned posts and makes them appear first.
Posts can have different types, and depending on their type, different content is provided in a post.
The simplest type is a text post. For this type, you only need to fill in the title and description. The description is optional.
The image type is similar to the text type but includes a thumbnail. You can upload any image as the thumbnail, as long as it meets the size and file type requirements listed under the upload button.
You can either upload your own video or link to a video from another site (such as YouTube) to create a post with the type
. If you upload your own video, you can also upload a thumbnail by uploading
. You can add any description you want.
For the audio type, you can upload any audio file. We will generate a visualizer with a custom player for the post. You can also upload
to customize the look of the player. You can include any description you want.

To make it easier for fans to navigate your posts, you can categorize them with tags. You can create as many tags as you want and assign them to as many posts as you see fit. Users can use tags to filter posts and view only those that are relevant to them.

You can assign posts to tiers. Regardless of the cost of each tier, posts will only be visible to users who are subscribed to one of the selected tiers. This allows fans to subscribe to multiple tiers that unlock different posts, instead of just upgrading their current subscription for more access.

If you set a price for pay-per-view, your fans will be able to unlock the specific post without needing to subscribe to any tiers. It's usually best to set the pay-per-view price lower than the tier price to make this option attractive to fans. Unlocking a post via pay-per-view will grant permanent access until you delete it.

You can attach any file to a post and include as many files as you like. The only limitation is the file size, which is displayed in the UI below the upload button. Your fans will be able to download attachments directly from the post.
Deleting a post will permanently remove all associated files, including thumbnails, videos, and attachments.
You can delete a post by clicking the red trash can icon on the post in

contents.title: Tiers
contents.description: All information on how you can manage tiers.

children.value: Tiers are used to lock your
When creating a tier, you must define these fields:
Defines the order in which tiers are displayed (Higher to lower).
After filling these fields, simply click the
button, and you can use it right away.
When editing a price, it doesn't update current subscriptions. It only affects subscriptions created after the change.
Editing tiers works the same way and uses the same form as when you create a new tier. Simply click the
You can see current subscribers to a tier by expanding the tier row.
Deleting a tier automatically cancels all subscriptions tied to it immediately.
If you want to delete a subscription so that no one can use or buy it anymore, simply click the trash icon on the tier card.

contents.title: Coupons
contents.description: This document provides comprehensive information on how we handle coupons, which act as promotional codes that fans can use when subscribing to a tier. Coupons can be customized to fit specific needs.

children.value: Once you create a coupon, you
it, only delete it. Ensure you configure the coupon correctly before creating it.
The following are the basic fields required for coupon creation:
Display name for your reference only.
The promotional code that fans will use.
The list of tiers for which this coupon can be used.
The number of times this coupon can be used.
Coupon expiration date. After this date, it cannot be used.
The duration field specifies how long the coupon will be active after being used.
Discount applies only to the first billing cycle (e.g., month).
Discount applies to all billing cycles until subscription cancellation.
Discount applies to a selected number of months.
The discount field defines the discount amount applied to the subscription.
: Subtracts a specific amount from the subscription price.
: Subtracts a specified percentage from the subscription price.
Deleting a coupon prevents it from being applied to future subscriptions or customers, but it doesnâ€™t remove the discount from any subscription or customer that already has it.
You can simply delete a coupon by clicking the trash icon in the coupon row.
We are working hard on finishing this part of the documentation.
We are working hard on finishing this part of the documentation.

contents.title: Billing
contents.description: All information about how we handle billing.

children.value: This page contains information about billing for paying fans. If you are a Creator and want to know more about how we handle billing for you, go to
Donations are the simplest way to support a creator.
You can donate to your creator by clicking the
button right under the creator's name on their page.
You choose the amount you want to send to the creator, as well as the message you include with your donation.
Tiers are subscriptions that allow you to access tier-restricted posts by creators.
Buying a subscription is easy. You can select one of the subscriptions shown at the top of the creator's page.
You can also buy a subscription displayed on a locked post.
You can view and cancel all of your subscriptions at
Be aware that if you buy pay-per-view to unlock a post, this doesn't guarantee permanent access to the content. The creator may still delete the post.
Pay-per-view is another option to unlock a creator's post.
If the creator has set up pay-per-view for a specific post, and you don't have the required tier to view it, you can use pay-per-view to unlock this specific post instead of buying a subscription.
For any payment you make on Creathors, we create an invoice for you.
Invoices always contain all the information about the product you purchased, including its price and currency.
The invoice includes your address, which you
Invoices also contain either your first and last name or your company name, if one is set. If you set a TAX ID for your company, it will be included as well.
You can see the list of your invoices and your current subscriptions at

contents.title: Creathors.com - Documentation
contents.description: Creathors.com is a dynamic platform where creators can share their content, engage with their audience, and monetize their work. Whether youâ€™re an artist, writer, or filmmaker, Creathors empowers you to showcase your talent. With customizable subscription tiers, fans can directly support their favorite creators while enjoying exclusive perks.

hero.title: Start building your community in seconds!
hero.description: On this page, you will find everything you might need or want to know about the Creathors Platform.

items.title: Billing
items.description: Powered by Stripe, our billing system ensures secure, fast, and flexible payment processing for creators and fans alike.

items.title: Posts
items.description: Share exclusive content with your fans through a variety of post types, tailored to suit your creative needs.

items.title: Tiers
items.description: Offer multiple tier options to create dynamic subscription plans and reward your fans in unique ways.

items.title: Coupons
items.description: Create promotional campaigns and exclusive discounts to grow your audience and reward loyal fans.

items.title: Alerts
items.description: Engage with your audience using real-time alerts for streams, posts, and other interactions.

items.title: Analytics
items.description: Track your growth with detailed analytics, offering insights to help you optimize your content and strategy.
